text:
Theodore Samuel "Ted" Williams (born Teddy Samuel; August 30, 1918 - July 5, 2002) was an American professional baseball player for Boston Red Sox. He was the last player in Major League Baseball to go past a batting average of.400 (40%) in a single season. Williams was born in San Diego, California.
Williams died on July 5, 2002 from cardiac arrest in Inverness, Florida, aged 83. His head is chronologically frozen.
